pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9437780030/job/25994036353)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9437780030/job/25994036227)

@urkud: my instinct was to leave these as not `simp` lemmas, since I'm not all that familiar with what's actually useful for `simp` to do when working on lists. Presumably at some point these will end up upstream somewhere, and I'll let the upstreamers decide whether `simp` is useful.

```suggestion
theorem take_range (m n : ℕ) : take m (range n) = range (min m n) := by
  apply List.ext_get <;> simp (config := { contextual := true }) [← get_take]
```
also, I think this theorem should be moved to `Mathlib.Data.List.Range`.
I think `lt_min_iff` is not available in that file

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add `List.iterate_add`
